bibl.title: Letter from J. F. Siler to Pedro Nogueira, February 10, 1954

div1.p: Siler offers to defray the cost of sending the Finlay Medals to their recipients by enclosing a check for that purpose.

div1.head: Letter from J. F. Siler to Pedro Nogueira, February 10, 1954
div1.opener:
Room 807, 1835 Eye St., N.W.,
Washington 6, D. C., U.S.A.,
February 10, 1954.
Dr. Pedro Nogueira
Marti 219, Marianao
Havana, Cuba
My dear Doctor Nogueira:
div1.p:
We are informed by Dr. Philip S. Hench, the Vice President of our
Association, that the Government of Cuba on Finlay Day, December 3, 1952,
honored the immediate relatives of the Yellow Fever personalities by author-
izing for them the Finlay Medal.

Dr. Hench further informed us that those so honored and who were not
present to receive the Decorations, were:

Major General Walter L. Reed, U.S.A., Retired
Brigadier General Albert E. Truby, U.S.A., Retired
Mrs. Blossom Reed
Mr. Houston Lazear
Mrs. W. D. Lazear Briggs
Major James B. Carroll (posthumously)
Mr. James L. Hanberry

We understand that it is customary for friends to defray the expenses of
the purchase of the medallion and rosette in each case at an approximate cost
of $35.00. Our Association would consider it a privilege if you will allow
us to defray this expense. We hope that the Decorations can be forwarded to
the recipients and in the name of your Government.
We are enclosing a check for $245.00, the estimated cost.

May we be permitted to express to you, and your associates, the sincere
appreciation of our Association for the action of the Cuban Government in
the preparation and dedication, on December 3, 1952, of the Lazear Park and
the several Memorial Medallions. We understand that you and others of your
distinguished associates contributed greatly to the fruition of the splendid
effort. It should be most helpful in promoting mutual appreciation of the
efforts of those who contributed to the discovery and demonstration of the
method of transmission of Yellow Fever.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Joseph F. Siler, Col., (MC), USA, Rtd. President, Board of Managers
Walter Reed Memorial Association
